main event: On 22 January 1953, Major Paul C. Taylor observed a silver, circular object in the sky over Honshu, Japan.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be about 30 feet in diameter,The object was traveling at a high rate of speed, estimated at over 1,000 miles per hour, The observation lasted approximately 15 seconds before the object disappeared, No vapor trail or exhaust was visible, The object moved with a smooth, gliding motion and did not resemble any known aircraft.
